attributes.action: Give children the meals that they deserve.
attributes.additional_details: They need to look at how their actions will properly affect children, families and other services. They need to re-evaluate their decision on stopping children getting free meals. Especially at christmas and in this time of need.
attributes.background: Change their decision on giving children the free meals that they deserve. It is a basic human right that is stated in the United Nations Convention of the Right of a Child act. Every child should be given the things they deserve to have a good start to life.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

Free school meals are usually only offered to eligible pupils during term time. The Government has launched a £170m Covid Winter Grant Scheme to support children, families and the most vulnerable to March 2021, with at least 80% of this funding earmarked to support with food and bills. The Holiday Activities and Food programme will also cover the Easter, Summer and Christmas holidays in 2021.
See https://www.gov.uk/government/news/new-winter-package-to-provide-further-support-for-children-and-families

You might like to sign the following petitions:

Extend free school meals over the Christmas period
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/555597

Fund free school meals over school holidays until April 2021
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/555727

Provide the free school meal entitlement throughout the year.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/555723
